definition: A mark or impression left behind by an object or a person, typically used to refer to the visible trace or imprint that something has made on a surface or material. It is commonly used in the context of forensic investigations, art, printing, or any situation where the replication or identification of a specific mark or pattern is important.

examples.german: Der Abdruck des Fußes im Sand war deutlich zu erkennen.
examples.english: The imprint of the foot in the sand was clearly visible.

examples.german: Der Abdruck des Stempels war verschmiert.
examples.english: The impression of the stamp was smudged.

examples.german: Der Abdruck des Tiers im Schnee führte zur Identifizierung.
examples.english: The animal's track in the snow led to identification.

examples.german: Der Abdruck des Reifens zeigte, dass das Auto zu schnell gefahren war.
examples.english: The tire mark indicated that the car was driving too fast.

examples.german: Der Abdruck des Lippenstifts war auf dem Glas zu sehen.
examples.english: The lipstick mark was visible on the glass.
